_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
 (40 CFR Part 68)

Facility, Stationary Sources & Regulated Substances Handled: Prevention
The chemical distribution facility at City of Industry (Don Julian Rd.) consists of a warehouse used to  ship, receive and store factory packaged regulated substances.  The warehouse was retrofitted in 2010 to meet Seismic risks.

General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps
As an active member of the National Association of Chemical Distributors, we maintain a documented program, The Responsible Distribution Process. With a focus on safety and environmental control, it includes SOPs, personnel training/competency requirements; Emergency Response Plans.

Policy: It is the policy of Norman, Fox & Co. to promote Senior Management Commitment through policy, communications, and resources, to on-going improvements in chemical compounding, chemical distribution and safety. 

Responsible Distribution Code: I.A. 

Senior Management Commitment is expressed through its :

1. Membership in the National Association of Chemical Distributors and adoption of the Responsible Distribution Code of Management Practice as the foundation policies for company safety, health and environmental management. 

2. Participation in Responsible DistributionA? including:
A?    adoption of policies to support program implementation
A?    appointment of a Responsible Distribution Coordinator 
A?    participation in NACD sanctioned RDP third party audits
A?    implementation of internal audits, including initiation of corrective and preventive actions based on audit results
A?    development and implementation of procedures to support each Responsible Distribution Code of Management Practices. 

3. Budgeting to: 
A?    upgrade facilities & equipment
A?    provide for personnel training.

4. This commitment is documented through development and maintenance of:
-    Responsible Distribution Process Procedures Manual, which meets requirements of a California Injury and Illness Pr

otection Program (California Code of Regulations, Title 8, Section 3203)
-    Quality Process Work Instructions in accordance with Food & Drug Administration requirements (21CFRA?211)
-    Emergency Response Plan. 

Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
Chemical    RMP per 40 CFR Pt 68    California Accidental Release Prevention Plan    Process Safety Manage-ment Plan    RMP/ PSM Processes

Cyclohexylamine            
1.    Shipping/Receiving
2.    Storage
3.    Empty Container Pick Up
4.    Preventive Maintenance
5.    Emergency Response

Formaldehyde 37%        
1.    Shipping/Receiving
2.    Storage
3.    Empty Container Pick Up
4.    Preventive Maintenance
5.    Emergency Response

Five Year Accident History
This is a new facility with an occupancy start date for chemical storage of June 10,2010. There have been no accidents as of this filing.

Emergency Response Program
A  Consolidated Contingency Plan is filed with the Los Angeles Co. Fire Dept. in accordance with California regulations. 

A more comprehensive Emergency Response Plan is maintained for use by the Facility Emergency Response authorities. 

All Operations personnel (i.e. warehouse, production, drivers) are trained and certified Hazwoper 1st Responder Operations level. Office personnel are in the process of training to Hazwoper 1st Responder Awareness Level   as it relates to this new location. These certificates are expected to be maintained. 

In response to a leak, spill, fire, explosion or airborne release, our Emergency Response Plan (tested annually)  is activated using   dedicated emergency equipment (15 pre-placed Spill Kits), and calling in our Response Contractor as required. The objective in response is to: protect personnel; control or contain any release; decontamination and waste disposal. 

The facility responds to Incidental and Non-Incidental Releases. When the release is non-incidental, the Fire Dept. is notified. This also occurs for any fire situation.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety
1.    Stationary sources are to be  located in a facility

retrofitted during 2010 to address Seismic Risk. 

2.    A new position, Environmental Health & Safety Manager has been created and filled. This qualified individual has been assigned as The Responsible Distribution Coordinator. He will attend Coordinator training during November 2010.

3.    Complete HAZWOPER Awareness training for all office personnel.

4.    Conduct Evacuation Exercise.

5.    Conduct Emergency Response Plan test with Operations personnel.

6.    Implement A?safety problemA? reporting system (STAR).

7.    Implement A?Employee RecognitionA? Program.
